Articles.Content:
I've build a rover and now I'm trying to send it to Duna. Unfortunately something happened and now I can't place any part normally (execpt for engines, docking ports, fuel tanks etc.) I've tried to rotate them but that lead to nowhere.

Here are some pictures:

PIC1

PIC2

PIC3

PIC4

Edited April 11, 2014 by gEshAdve

I'm guessing you brought the rover over from the SPH?

I haven't seen it quite like this before. You can try to exit out to the menu and back in (or a complete game restart) to reset the symmetry.

Also, you can move the rover between the SPH and VAB by making it a sub-assembly. That will help keep the file from retaining the "SPH" tag.

If you want to just edit the file, open the .craft and change the "SPH" to "VAB"
Yeah, that looks like what happened when I started something in SPH and moved it to VAB.

I'm guessing you brought the rover over from the SPH?

I haven't seen it quite like this before. You can try to exit out to the menu and back in (or a complete game restart) to reset the symmetry.

Also, you can move the rover between the SPH and VAB by making it a sub-assembly. That will help keep the file from retaining the "SPH" tag.

If you want to just edit the file, open the .craft and change the "SPH" to "VAB"

I haven't brought it from the SPH. I built it in the VAB and then I built the rocket that will hopefully it to Duna. I can't make the rover a sub-assembly part and I don't know why.

You have your root part horizontally, that's why it does this. Place the root part vertically (even temporarily) and it will work.

Edit: simple reproduction

Javascript is disabled. View full album

It worked !!!!! Thank you very very much !!!
